channel.title: Build Asset Management
channel.description: Credit Manager in Public and Private Markets

item.title: Dividend Announcement: Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) on 9/24/2025 declared a dividend of $0.0703 per share
item.description: The Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) on 9/24/2025 declared a dividend of $0.0703 per share payable on 9/26/2025 to shareholders of record as of 9/25/2025. The Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) has paid dividends since 2022 and has a 12-month dividend yield of 3.57%.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: The Evolution of Bitcoin ETFs Around the World
item.description: This Bitcoin 2025 discussion traces the explosive growth of Bitcoin ETFs worldwide, starting with early European products and culminating in the US tsunami of adoption. Panelists break down legal frameworks, from civil to common law, and the impact of SEC litigation. Explore in-kind mechanisms in Australia and Hong Kong that enhance efficiency. Hear how institutions like sovereign funds are embracing Bitcoin as a wedge for stability.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Dividend Announcement: Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) on 8/27/2025 declared a dividend of $0.0681 per share
item.description: The Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) on 8/27/2025 declared a dividend of $0.0681 per share payable on 8/29/2025 to shareholders of record as of 8/28/2025. The Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) has paid dividends since 2022 and has a 12-month dividend yield of 3.73%.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: The Private Credit Bitcoin Cycle w/ Matt Dines | Bitcoin for Corporations Ep. 13
item.description: On this episode of the Bitcoin for Corporations Show, Host Pierre Rochard interviews Build Asset Management co-founder Matt Dines. Dines explains why Bitcoin as collateral is still only 1% adopted and why the credit markets represent trillions in opportunity. Dines shares his background in capital markets and why Build is focused on credit as the battlefront.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin Collateral & GSE Reform: A $40 Trillion Credit Revolution
item.description: Build CIO, Matt Dines, unpacks how the Genius Act, Bitcoin-backed mortgages, and GSE reform could reboot US credit, reshape the housing market, and keep the dollar system alive on The Bitcoin Layer with Nik Bhatia.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Dividend Announcement: Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) on 4/28/2025 declared a dividend of $0.0727 per share
item.description: The Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) on 4/29/2025 declared a dividend of $0.0727 per share payable on 4/30/2025 to shareholders of record as of 4/29/2025. The Build Bond Innovation ETF (NYSE: BFIX) has paid dividends since 2022 and has a 12-month dividend yield of 4.11%.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: The Cantilever Podcast - Pod 38
item.description: Matt shares his journey into Bitcoin and its potential as collateral for credit expansion, emphasizing its importance in preserving purchasing power amid rising US Treasury debt. He discusses the transition from traditional fiat systems to Bitcoin-backed credit, forecasting a $40 trillion credit expansion over the next decade. Matt also dives into the geopolitical shift from a unipolar to a multi-polar world and how Bitcoin could play a key role in diversifying reserve assets beyond the US dollar.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin Backed Credit Makes The Grade: Announcement w/ Matt Dines
item.description: From explaining the current landscape of Bitcoin in credit markets to revealing the strategic importance of investment grade ratings, this talk provides a clear roadmap for understanding Bitcoin's integration into traditional financial systems. Learn why this development matters for the future of corporate finance and Bitcoin adoption.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: The Future of Collateral: Why Bitcoin is the Ideal Asset w/ Adam Reeds, Matt Dines, Andrew Hohns
item.description: Explore how Bitcoin is revolutionizing credit markets with industry leaders from Lin.io, Build Asset Management, and Battery Finance. This groundbreaking discussion reveals how Bitcoin's properties as pristine collateral are transforming traditional lending, from mining operations to real estate financing.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Build Secured Income Fund I Preps Offering of Secured Notes in Q1 2025
item.description: Build Secured Income Fund I (the “Fund”), an asset-backed lending private credit fund, and Build Asset Management, today announced preparations for a secured note offering (the “Notes”) with an anticipated early Q1 2025 launch. The Fund intends to use the net proceeds of the Notes for general corporate purposes, including the purchase of asset-backed loans within the small- and mid-market corporate direct lending space.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Countdown to Election: Treasury Moves and Rising Rates Poised to Shape 2024 Markets
item.description: Build CIO, Matt Dines, unveils the high-stakes dynamics of U.S. Treasury issuance and its immediate ripple effects on markets, set against the backdrop of the upcoming election.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: China Launches Massive Stimulus
item.description: Listen to Build CIO, Matt Dines, break down what recent Chinese central bank rate moves and the creation of a new collateral facility mean for markets on The Bitcoin Layer with Nik Bhatia.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin Solves the US Sovereign Debt Crisis?
item.description: Listen to the live conversation on TFTC with Build CIO, Matt Dines, on the Bitcoin-backed credit market, Bitcoin vs. stablecoin strategies, and how Bitcoin can help solve the US sovereign debt crisis.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin-Focused Direct Lending Fund Posts One-Year Anniversary
item.description: One year ago, the Build Secured Income Fund I (the "Fund") opened to fee-paying clients. Over this time the Fund delivered an 11.27% net return on invested capital, paid distributions monthly, used zero leverage, and experienced no loan losses.
item.author: Matt Dines

item.title: Build Asset Management to Donate 10% of Management Fees to Support Human Rights and Financial Freedom
item.description: Proceeds from Build Secured Income Fund I, a bitcoin-backed private credit fund, will support the Human Rights Foundation and OpenSats charities.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Powell Puts the Landing Gear Down
item.description: Listen to the live discussion with Build CIO, Matt Dines, on the Fed, gold, and currencies with Michael Gayed.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: U.S. Treasury Wraps Up Buyback Trials: What’s Next?
item.description: With buyback trials completed, the U.S. Treasury is ready to unclog the “off the runs” from its debt distribution pipes. Dissecting the plan.
item.author: Matt Dines

item.title: A Global Banking Crisis is the Endgame
item.description: Matt Dines, CIO, walks through the latest in the troubled banking sector, including how commercial real estate losses will trickle down throughout the world. We also take a look at some long term charts of the dollar and US Treasury yields to understand the United States position under perpetual deficits and sky-high debt levels. We conclude with Matt's opinion that the last excuse to buy bitcoin at asset managers is now gone.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: 2023 Year-End Limited Partner Letter
item.description: Interest rates and Bitcoin appear ready to enter new phases in 2024. We believe this presents an environment in which the Build Secured Income Fund I (the "Fund") is distinctly positioned to thrive among its peers.
item.author: Matt Dines

item.title: New Year Narratives: AI & ETFs with Matt Dines
item.description: With the potential approval of a Bitcoin ETF on the horizon, we discuss the implications for the financial markets and the strategic positioning of institutions and nation-states in relation to Bitcoin.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin Expedition 2023
item.description: The Bitcoin Expedition 2023 event featured an education-focused day with some of the most influential Bitcoiners sharing their knowledge of what Bitcoin is, why it can be a superior money, and how it can impact industry and culture.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin Expedition Comes to Jefferson City
item.description: Bitcoin has gotten its fair share of national attention over recent weeks, and we were thrilled to host a packed house for a day full of conversations exploring the potential opportunities Bitcoin presents to our local Missouri community with notable national and regional thought leaders.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin-Backed Private Credit
item.description: Our Co-Founder and CIO, Matt Dines, spoke with Bloomberg Radio’s Paul Sweeney about the value proposition behind our Build Secured Income Fund I -- how we believe Bitcoin serves as compelling collateral compared to other options such as commercial real estate which we believe are more time intensive and costly to settle in the recovery process.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin as Collateral: An Attractive Tool for Business Owners AND Private Credit
item.description: Build CEO, John Ruth recently connected with Joshua Friedeman, host of the Business Bitcoinization podcast to discuss the real world application of using Bitcoin as collateral.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Build Asset Management Debuts Bitcoin-Backed Private Credit Fund in Partnership with Unchained
item.description: Accredited investors and institutions can now access a new private credit solution that holds short-duration, senior secured, over-collateralized consumer and business loans providing potentially attractive yieldBuild Asset Management (“Build”), an investment manager focused on income and risk mitigation in public and private credit markets, announces the launch of the Build Secured Income Fund I in partnership with Unchained.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin-backed direct lending brings crypto to private credit
item.description: Our Co-Founder and CIO, Matt Dines, had the great opportunity to speak with Shubham Saharan of 9fin about the launch of our Build Secure Income Fund and how it uniquely leverages the characteristics of Bitcoin as its collateral against the securitized loan to deliver an attractive yield profile for investors.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Is the Treasury Market Breaking?
item.description: In this episode, we are joined by Build CIO Matt Dines. Matt walks us through the epic bear market in Treasuries and projects that investors are approaching yield levels that will bring portfolios a lot of pain. Nik asks Matt to explain why the 3-month/6-month Treasury bill curve is inverted and what it means for markets.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Bitcoin Swings the Pendulum Back to the Jeffersonian Ideal
item.description: The arrival and ascent of a self-reliant money represents a rhythmic shift back to the ideals of liberty, individual rights, and civic virtue as America advances into the 21st century.
item.author: Matt Dines

item.title: BlackRock ETF and the Future of Retirement Plans, with Matt Dines
item.description: The world's largest asset manager, BlackRock, made waves last month by submitting an SEC filing for a spot Bitcoin ETF. Build Co-Founder and CIO Matt Dines, CFA, sat down with Marty Bent, Jesse Myers, and Michael Tanguma on The Last Trade podcast to discuss the chances of the SEC permitting the ETF and the potential implications for American retirement savers.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Retirement Funds in the Age of Bitcoin
item.description: Build Co-Founder and CIO Matt Dines, CFA, sat down with Marty Bent of TFTC to discuss the past and future US retirement landscape, and how to handle a potential large-scale adoption of Bitcoin as a store of value.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: 401k’s, Fund Building, and Crypto!
item.description: What is it like going from being a financial advisor to building and managing investment products? Build Co-Founder and CEO John Ruth sat down with Dennis Mattern on The Complete Advisor to discuss the inspiration for Build and his journey from one side of the investments industry to the other.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: Elevated Stress as the Debt Ceiling Approaches?
item.description: In this episode, Joe & Matt Dines of Build Asset Management discuss the abundance of dollars still in the system, when the next credit event may occur, and drama as we approach the debt ceiling.
item.author: Build Asset Management

item.title: 401(k) Contribution Limits To Increase 10%; Majority Do Not Take Maximum Advantage
item.description: Investors should consider taking advantage of higher 401(k) contribution limits to build a retirement nest egg or catch up on savings.
item.author: Dave Martin

item.title: Index-Hugging Bond ETFs May Not Be Ideal for Investors
item.description: Weak fund performance can likely be attributed to rising interest rates and managers' unwillingness to stray too far from the benchmark.

item.title: Tax Loss Harvesting Should Be Top of Mind for Bond Investors
item.description: Opportunities for tax loss harvesting should be regularly reviewed in every taxable portfolio, not just when taxes are top of mind.

item.title: High Yield Bonds - History Shows that Reaching for Yield Can Lead to Disaster
item.description: Reaching for income in high yield bonds is little different than ascending the top step of a ladder to get something just out of reach.

item.title: May 2022 FOMC Minutes: Good News, Bad News, and a Lot of Uncertainty Ahead
item.description: The FOMC's meeting minutes paint an optimistic tone, projecting confidence that a shift to "neutral" will be enough to bring down inflation.

item.description: Matt Dines was a guest on the Gaining Perspectives podcast, discussing this three takeaways from the Fed rate hike announced in March 2022.

item.description: Investors opening their quarterly statements from Q1 2022 may be finding something they probably haven’t seen much of recently: lots of red.

item.description: Matt Dines shares his thoughts on managing current geopolitical risks within investors' portfolios with Pensions & Investments Magazine.

item.description: John Ruth explains how the fund combines the risk-mitigating elements of investment-grade fixed income with the upside potential of equity markets.

item.description: For the past four decades, bonds have been on a great run. Investing in bonds today will in most cases yield you a negative real return.
